src:
V stenah Ospa po 20 letih spet velika uharica
01 Nov 2019, 10:57 by STA

V desni del plezalne Velike stene v Ospu se je po 20 letih vrnila naša največja sova, velika uharica, so sporočilo Zavoda RS za varstvo narave objavili pri Projektu O.S.P. Gre za občutljivo in ogroženo sovo, zato plezalce prosijo, naj v tistem delu stene ne plezajo.



Velika uharica Foto: Tomaž Mihelič/DOPPS

ČRNI KAL > “Kot kaže, so se plezalci držali dogovorov, naj se tam ne pleza, in to je obrodilo sadove. Ob večerih se v vasi spet sliši njeno guganje. Sedaj išče prostor, kje bi lahko spomladi v miru vzgajala svoje potomce,” so, kot so objavili na strani Projekta Opremimo slovenska plezališča (O.S.P.) na facebooku, sporočili iz zavoda za varstvo narave.
Dodali so, da vrnitev sove kaže tudi na to, da je v Ospu možno sobivanje plezalcev tudi s to občutljivo in ogroženo sovo. Plezalce prosijo, da do nadaljnjega ne dostopajo do desnega dela Velike stene in nadelujejo novih smeri. Zadnja smer, ki se lahko nemoteno pleza, je smer Medo.
text:
In the walls of Ospa, after 20 years, a big earwig again
01 Nov 2019, 10:57 by STA

After 20 years, our largest owl, the great earl, has returned to the right part of the climbing Great Wall in Osp. This is a sensitive and endangered owl, so they ask climbers not to climb walls in that area.



Large earring Photo: Tomaž Mihelič / DOPPS

BLACK CAL> "Apparently, the climbers kept to the agreement not to climb there, and this bore fruit. In the evenings, her roar is heard again in the village. Now she is looking for a place where she can raise her offspring in the spring, ”according to the Facebook page of the Equip Slovene Climbing Grounds (O.S.P.) project, reported from the Institute for Nature Conservation.
They added that the return of the owl also indicates that climbing with this delicate and endangered owl is possible in Osp. Climbers are asked not to continue to access the right part of the Great Wall and continue new directions. The last direction that can climb smoothly is the Medo direction.
